intro: Strychnos atherstonei, commonly known as the Atherstone's strychnos, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Its leaves are simple and alternate, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain toxic seeds. Due to its toxicity, it is important to handle the plant with care.
